sourceMeaningMnemonic: You <radical>change</radical> this <radical>geoduck</radical> because you want it to <kanji>lean</kanji>. Right now it's standing up straight, but you want it to lean to one side instead.
meaningInfo: Why do you want this geoduck to lean? Try to come up with your own reason. And why don't you look up what a geoduck looks like one more time for good measure. You don't want to be able to get this image out of your head.
readingMnemonic: To get the geoduck to <kanji>lean</kanji> you put a piece of <reading>ca</reading>ke (<ja>けい</ja>) on one of its sides.
readingInfo: Watch as the geoduck slowly leans toward the cake, trying to get at it for a taste. But don't let it eat any! Keep putting the cake further and further away so the geoduck has to lean more.
